snippet: The Pentagon is “reviewing all options” against the author of a book about the raid that killed Osama bin Laden, but has stopped short of calling on his publisher to stop or delay the book’s release next week.
abstract: Pentagon threatens to take legal action against Matt Bissonnette, the former member of the Navy SEALs who has written a first-person account of the raid that killed Osama bin Laden, for revealing classified information and failing to submit his book to the Pentagon for review; the book No Easy Day is scheduled for publication by Penguin on Sept 4.

byline.original: By ELISABETH BUMILLER and JULIE BOSMAN
byline.contributor: Elisabeth Bumiller reported from Washington, and Julie Bosman from New York.

lead_paragraph: The Pentagon is “reviewing all options” against the author of a book about the raid that killed Osama bin Laden, but has stopped short of calling on his publisher to stop or delay the book’s release next week.

headline.seo: Pentagon Threatens Legal Action Against SEAL Author Matt Bissonnette
headline.main: Pentagon Threatens Legal Action Against SEAL Author
headline.print_headline: Author of Account of Bin Laden Raid May Face Legal Action
